Package chess

Class King

java.lang.Object
chess.Piece
chess.King
public class King
extends Piece
This class is used to represent a King in the game. As such, this Piece is allowed to move one space at a time and is allowed to castle with its Rooks if castle requirements are met. This Piece's location is also tracked by the Board object in order to check for checks.
Author:
Savan Patel, Naveenan Yogeswaran

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    King​(java.lang.String id, char color, char type, int col, int row, Board board)
    This constructor creates a King object using the super constructor of the Piece class.

    This method will check if the passed row and column is a valid spot for the King to move to.
    int movePiece​(int rank, int file)
    This method will move the King to the given rank and file, and update the board's coordinate.

  • Constructor Details

    • King

      public King​(java.lang.String id, char color, char type, int col, int row, Board board)
      This constructor creates a King object using the super constructor of the Piece class.
      Parameters:
      id - 'wK' or 'bK'.
      color - Which color the King belongs to ('w' = White or 'b' = Black).
      type - 'K' for King.
      col - What column index the King is currently on in 'board' (0 to 7).
      row - What row index the King is currently on in 'board' (0 to 7).
      board - The Board object that the King belongs to.

  • Method Details

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid​(int rank, int file)
      This method will check if the passed row and column is a valid spot for the King to move to.
      Specified by:
      isValid in class Piece
      Parameters:
      rank - The inputed rank of the next position (0 to 7).
      file - The inputed file of the next position (0 to 7).
      Returns:
      True if the move is valid. False if the move is invalid.

    • movePiece

      public int movePiece​(int rank, int file)
      This method will move the King to the given rank and file, and update the board's coordinate.
      Specified by:
      movePiece in class Piece
      Parameters:
      rank - The inputed rank of the next position (0 to 7).
      file - The inputed file of the next position (0 to 7).
      Returns:
      2 if there is a checkmate. 1 if the move doesn't lead to checkmate but does lead to check. 0 if neither is true.
